intro: Hieracium farinulentum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium farinulentum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
